thread.title: Moana star Auli'i Cravalho gets hit in the face during Oscars performance but handles it like a pro
thread.title_full: Moana star Auli'i Cravalho gets hit in the face during Oscars performance but handles it like a pro

author: Zoe Shenton
title: Moana star Auli'i Cravalho gets hit in the face during Oscars performance but handles it like a pro
text:
Moana star Auli'i Cravalho was accidentally hit in the face with a flag as she performed on stage at the 89th annaul Academy Awards on Sunday. 
The teen was introduced by Hamilton star Lin-Manuel Miranda before she launced into a rendition of How Far I'll Go. 
But as she performended the song for the audience in the Dolby Theatre, she got hit in the head by a flag. 
A group of dancers waved the blue flags behind her, but one got a little too close and caught her on the side of the face. 
Apart from a little squint, the young star took it all in her stride and carried on as if nothing happened. Actor/singer Auli'i Cravalho performs onstage (Photo: REUTERS) Actor/singer Auli'i Cravalho performs onstage (Photo: Getty Images North America) Actor/singer Auli'i Cravalho performs onstage (Photo: REUTERS) 
Meanwhile, elsewhere in the show, first-time Oscars host Jimmy Kimmel wasted no time before he took aim at President Donald Trump - and others - in his opening monologue. 
"This broadcast is being watched live by millions of Americans and around the world in more than 225 countries that now hate us," he said from inside   Hollywood. 
He continued: "The country is divided right now," he said, explaining that he would not be the man to bring the country together. (Photo: XPUSJP) 
"There's only one Brave Heart in the room and he's not going to unite us either." 
The camera then cut to Mel Gibson, nominated for best director. "Mel, you look great," he quipped. "The Scientology is helping." 
He also reignited his long-running 'feud' with Matt Damon. (Photo: REUTERS) (Photo: jimmykimmel/Instagram) 
Jimmy earnestly encouraged everyone watching to reach out to someone during this divided time in the political climate, before explaining that he was ready to "bury the hatchet" with someone he has "had issues with" - Matt. 
"I've known Matt for a long time," he said. "When I first met Matt, I was the fat one." 
The host then took a jab at Damon for giving Casey Affleck his Oscar-nominated role in Manchester by the Sea and making "a Chinese pony tail movie instead," in reference to The Great Wall. Like us on Facebook
